Treatment: Call an ambulance immediately
If patient is conscious, get them to consume 300mg tablet of Aspirin
If patient is unconscious, monitor their breathing
If patient has stopped breathing, perform CPR
If patient has no pulse, use AED
Call an ambulance immediately
If patient is unconscious, monitor patient's breathing
If patient has stopped breathing, perform CPR
Move patient to cool place
Apply ice packs to patient's neck and armpits
Let patient lie down with legs slightly elevated
Get patient to drink plenty of fluids
Cool the burn/scald area under running water for at least 20 minutes
Remove any clothing/jewellery from the burn/scald area if it is not attached to patient's skin
Loosely cover the burn/scald area with clean dressing
If burn/scald area is large/severe, call an ambulance
If patient is unconscious, call an ambulance, monitor patient's breathing
If patient has stopped breathing, perform CPR
Apply ice pack to any bruise/swelling on patient's head
Apply ice pack around sprained joint
If possible, keep sprained joint elevated
Call an ambulance
Apply ice pack around injured area
If possible, keep injured area elevated to reduce swelling
DO NOT attempt to pop dislocated joint back into place
If wound is deep/large, call an ambulance
If foreign object is present in wound, DO NOT attempt to remove it
Clean wound with water
Cover wound with clean gauze and secure gauze with bandage
Apply firm, direct pressure on wound to slow bleeding
Calm the patient down
Instruct patient to take 6 breaths into paper bag, 6 breaths without paper bag, repeat
If symptoms do not improve, call an ambulance
Lay something soft beneath patient's head
Remove any sharp objects from patient's surroundings
If seizure lasts longer than 5 minutes, call an ambulance
